str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn back, return. From hupo and strepho; to turn under, i.e. To return.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
